Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Celebrity \Ce*leb"ri*ty\, n.; pl. {Celebrities}. [L. celebritas: cf. F. c['e]l['e]brit['e].] 1. Celebration; solemnization. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
The celebrity of the marriage. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
2. The state or condition of being celebrated; fame; renown; as, the celebrity of Washington. [1913 Webster]
An event of great celebrity in the history of astronomy. --Whewell. [1913 Webster]
3. A person of distinction or renown; -- usually in the plural; as, he is one of the celebrities of the place. [1913 Webster]
celebrity n 1: a widely known person; "he was a baseball celebrity" [syn: {famous person}] 2: the state or quality of being widely honored and acclaimed [syn: {fame}, {renown}] [ant: {infamy}]
